properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 9:07PM CST until January 12 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
...Significant Snow and Ice Accumulations Possible late Friday
Night Through Saturday Night...

* WHAT...A mix of freezing rain and sleet is likely late Friday
night and Saturday, mainly over northern Cook, north and west
of downtown. The mixed precipitation may then change over to a
period of accumulating snow Saturday evening. Total ice and
sleet accumulations in excess of a quarter inch are possible
late Friday night into Saturday, mainly over northern Cook.
Total snow accumulations in excess of 3 inches are also
possible Saturday evening, with the highest amounts over
northern Cook. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph Friday night
and Saturday.

* WHERE...Northern Cook County.

* WHEN...Late Friday night through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
